channel.title: Coco AI App
channel.description: Recent content on Coco AI App

item.title: macOS
item.description: macOS # Download Coco AI # Go to coco.rs and download the package of your architecture: It should be placed in your “Downloads” folder: Unzip DMG file # Unzip the file: You will get a dmg file: Drag to Application Folder # Double click the dmg file, a window will pop up. Then drag the “Coco-AI” app to your “Applications” folder:

item.title: Screenshot
item.description: Screenshot # Screenshot Gallery # Here are some screenshots showcasing the user interface: Search Local Desktop Applications Seamlessly search through your local apps directly from Coco AI. Search Across Personal & Enterprise Knowledge Bases Perform hybrid searches across multiple data sources, including personal and company knowledge bases. Chat with Your AI Assistant Interact with the AI assistant, which leverages your personal knowledge base to provide detailed and intelligent answers.

item.title: Ubuntu
item.description: Ubuntu # NOTE: Coco app only works fully under X11. Don’t know if you running X11 or not? take a look at this question! Go to the download page # Download page: link Download the package # Download the package of your architecture, it should be put in your Downloads directory and look like this: $ cd ~/Downloads $ ls Coco-AI-x.y.z-bbbb-deb-linux-amd64.zip # or Coco-AI-x.y.z-bbbb-deb-linux-arm64.zip depending on your architecture Install it # Unzip and install it

item.title: Windows
item.description: Windows # Download Coco AI # Goto https://coco.rs/ Install Wizard #
